meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling a chancre.
meanings.sent1: The doctor identified the chancrous sore on the patient's lip.
meanings.sent2: The chancrous lesion was a clear sign of the disease.
meanings.sent3: The chancrous spot on the apple made it look like it had a tiny volcano.
meanings.sent4: The chancrous appearance of the wound was a stark reminder of the infection.
meanings.sent5: The chancrous growth on the plant spread rapidly, causing concern among the gardeners.

meanings.definition: Having the characteristics of a chancre.
meanings.sent1: The chancrous ulcer was painful and needed immediate attention.
meanings.sent2: The chancrous sore was a troubling symptom of the illness.
meanings.sent3: The chancrous mark on the wall looked like a tiny crater from a meteor.
meanings.sent4: Her chancrous cough echoed through the room, alarming everyone present.
meanings.sent5: The chancrous smell coming from the garbage can was unbearable, prompting a thorough cleaning.
